page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: The area is typical of upland Aberdeenshire, where main farming consists of arable and stock rearing.Approximately 10%-20% is used for enclosed rough grazing. 5%-8% of land consists of small areas of coniferous plantation. The remainder of 70% is equally divided between intensive grass farming and crop farming. Intensive grass land is utilised by (1) suckler cows producing beef calves (2) fattening cattle (from the above calves) (3) upland sheep producing fat and store lambs. Crop farming consists of (1) Winter/Spring barley for animal feed and malting. (2) swedes and turnips for stock feed. (3) potatoes (small area mainly for seed)
